alert.note: Alert for South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 3:06AM MST until January 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PROLONGED PERIOD OF HEAVY SNOW AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS LATE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .Light snow will decrease towards dawn with a lull in the snowfall expected Friday morning. Snow will increase in coverage and intensity later Friday afternoon and night with arrival of next shot of energy and deeper moisture. The heaviest snow will impact the Park Range, including Rabbit Ears Pass, and to a slightly lesser extent the northern Front Range mountains (Medicine Bow Range, Rocky Mountain NP). Additionally, strong winds will be present at times through Friday night, resulting in blowing snow, poor visibility and treacherous conditions for most mountains passes/roadways. Lighter snow will impact the I-70 mountain corridor beginning Friday, and will lead to deteriorated conditions coinciding with weekend ski traffic. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected with the heaviest rates occurring tonight. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute and the Saturday morning ski traffic.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
